Summary Note:
The RM first met Schulze Klein Schulz at a wine tasting event in Berlin. They discovered a shared passion for fine wines and decided to explore potential business ventures together.
Schulze Klein Schulz is a 70 year old retired Curator from Germany.
He was impressed by Julius Baer's global presence and expertise in private banking, leading to the decision to join.
Family Background: Schulze Klein Schulz has been happily married to Sofia since 1989. They are proud parents of 2 children: Schwarz and Fabienne.
Education Background:
Schulze earned his secondary school diploma from Heisenberg-Gymnasium Lüneburg in 1972.
Schulze earned his degree from University of Hamburg in 1979.
Occupation History:
Schulze Klein Schulz is a 70 year old and comes from Germany.
In 1979, Schulze Klein Schulz started working as a Art Dealer at Museum Folkwang Essen, marking the beginning of his successful career.
In 1983, he moved to Nationalgalerie Berlin to work as a Gallery Owner, applying his knowledge to achieve outstanding performance.
At Museum Folkwang Essen, he worked as a Art Advisor from 1984 to 1985, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
After 6 years of dedication, he assumed the role of Curator at Bayerische Staatsgemäldesammlungen in 1987, spearheading high-profile projects and mentoring junior colleagues.
Wealth Summary:
While working, he saved 1670000 EUR, which he used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
He owns villa in Bonn, where he resides. It is worth 2810000 EUR.

He purchased flat in Braunschweig, where he spends his holidays. It is valued at 820000 EUR.
Moreover, he has invested in additional property in Hanover, giving possiblity for generating additional income. The villa is valued at 2810000 EUR.

He does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: The RM is very happy to have Schulze as a customer and is looking forward to a long and successful cooperation.
